section.title: Trial message still appears after activating license.

sectiondiv.p: Even after a license has been activated, the trial version message still appears.

p.systemoutput: You are using an unlicensed and unsupported version of .... Please contact your Systems Administrator for information on how to obtain a valid license.
You are using a trial version of Evoq .... You currently have ... days remaining before your trial period expires.

dd.p: See Activate License Automatically for instructions.
If the server does not have Internet access while the license is being activated on it, see Activate License Manually.

dlentry.dt: Cause: Site moved from one server to another.

dd.p: Verify that the license is activated at both the server level and the IIS level. The Licensing FAQ contains more details on this and a guide to activating a license correctly.
While logged in as a Host, go to Tools Clear Cache.

dlentry.dt: Cause: Incorrect or missing settings in web.config.

dd.p: Additional symptom: You might also see the following error linked to DotNetNuke.Professional.Application.ProApplication.CheckLicense():

p.systemoutput: String reference not set to an instance of a String.

ol.li:
Verify that the following nodes exist in web.config (The date and license type may differ.):
InstallationDate:
<add key="InstallationDate" value="9/2/2009" />
Two licensing nodes:
<add name="Licensing" type="DotNetNuke.Professional.HttpModules.LicenseValidatorModule, DotNetNuke.Professional" preCondition="managedHandler" /> <add name="Licensing" type="DotNetNuke.Professional.HttpModules.LicenseValidatorModule, DotNetNuke.Professional" />

dd.p: An invoice for one Evoq product cannot be used to license a different Evoq product. Example: An Evoq Content invoice is invalid for Evoq Engage. Verify that the correct invoice number and email are used.

dlentry.dt: Cause: Application Pool Identity account with invalid or read-only profile.

dd.p: If you are running the application pool under a custom domain account in Microsoft .NET Framework 4, verify that the domain user has a valid profile.
Also verify that the profile is not read-only; otherwise, the license key is not decrypted and the trial version message is displayed.
